name: R5-TaskIntent-R4-TaskIntent
title: Concept map to convert a FHIR R5 TaskIntent into FHIR R4

element.display: The request represents the view of an authorization instantiated by a fulfilling system representing the details of the fulfiller's intention to act upon a submitted order.

target.display: The request represents the view of an authorization instantiated by a fulfilling system representing the details of the fulfiller's intention to act upon a submitted order.
target.comment: R5 `filler-order` is assumed equivalent to R4 `filler-order` (no map, but codes match)

element.display: An order created in fulfillment of a broader order that represents the authorization for a single activity occurrence.  E.g. The administration of a single dose of a drug.

target.display: An order created in fulfillment of a broader order that represents the authorization for a single activity occurrence.  E.g. The administration of a single dose of a drug.
target.comment: R5 `instance-order` is assumed equivalent to R4 `instance-order` (no map, but codes match)

element.display: The request represents a component or option for a RequestOrchestration that establishes timing, conditionality and/or other constraints among a set of requests.  Refer to [[[RequestOrchestration]]] for additional information on how this status is used.

target.display: The request represents a component or option for a RequestGroup that establishes timing, conditionality and/or other constraints among a set of requests.  Refer to [[[RequestGroup]]] for additional information on how this status is used.
target.comment: R5 `option` is assumed equivalent to R4 `option` (no map, but codes match)

element.display: The request represents a request/demand and authorization for action by the requestor.

target.display: The request represents a request/demand and authorization for action by a Practitioner.
target.comment: R5 `order` is assumed equivalent to R4 `order` (no map, but codes match)

element.display: The request represents an original authorization for action.

target.display: The request represents an original authorization for action.
target.comment: R5 `original-order` is assumed equivalent to R4 `original-order` (no map, but codes match)

element.display: The request represents an intention to ensure something occurs without providing an authorization for others to act.

target.display: The request represents an intention to ensure something occurs without providing an authorization for others to act.
target.comment: R5 `plan` is assumed equivalent to R4 `plan` (no map, but codes match)

element.display: The request is a suggestion made by someone/something that does not have an intention to ensure it occurs and without providing an authorization to act.

target.display: The request is a suggestion made by someone/something that does not have an intention to ensure it occurs and without providing an authorization to act.
target.comment: R5 `proposal` is assumed equivalent to R4 `proposal` (no map, but codes match)

element.display: The request represents an automatically generated supplemental authorization for action based on a parent authorization together with initial results of the action taken against that parent authorization.

target.display: The request represents an automatically generated supplemental authorization for action based on a parent authorization together with initial results of the action taken against that parent authorization.
target.comment: R5 `reflex-order` is assumed equivalent to R4 `reflex-order` (no map, but codes match)

element.display: The intent is not known.  When dealing with Task, it's not always known (or relevant) how the task was initiated - i.e. whether it was proposed, planned, ordered or just done spontaneously.

target.display: The intent is not known.  When dealing with Task, it's not always known (or relevant) how the task was initiated - i.e. whether it was proposed, planned, ordered or just done spontaneously.
target.comment: R5 `unknown` is assumed equivalent to R4 `unknown` (no map, but codes match)
